      • ImageQuestion

                     java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)

      • ImageQuestion

        public ImageQuestion(@NotNull
                     java.lang.String name,
                     @Nullable
                     java.lang.String question,
                     @NotNull
                     GenericUtils.QuestionType questionType,
                     @NotNull
                     java.util.ArrayList<AnswerChoice> answerChoices,
                     @NotNull
                     java.util.ArrayList<AnswerChoice> correctAnswerChoices,
                     boolean scrambleAnswers,
                     boolean answerOrderMatters,
                     @Nullable
                     java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Advanced constructor. Creates unlocked com.vasolsim.common.file.Question with a given image.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the question
        question - the text of the question
        questionType - the type of question (how the question will be rendered)
        answerChoices - the answer choices
        correctAnswerChoices - the correct answer choices
        scrambleAnswers - if the order of the answers will be scrambled when the test viewer renders the question
        answerOrderMatters - if the order of the answers is needed for a correct answer. Only applies to certain question types.
        image - the image

    • Method Detail

      • getImage

        @Nullable
public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getImage()
        gets the image attached to the question
        Returns:
        the image

      • setImage

        public final boolean setImage(@Nullable
                              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        sets the image attached to the question, only if the question is unlocked. Will re-render the buffered image to JavaFX image as well; if the image is large, you may need to handle this operation in a thread.
        Parameters:
        image - the image

      • getFxImage

        @Nullable
public javafx.scene.image.Image getFxImage()
        gets the JavaFX image version of the image resource
        Returns:
        the JavaFX image

        Parameters:
